org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang

Class XMLConcurrencyTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.XMLConcurrencyTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class XMLConcurrencyTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Test that XML operators can be invoked by multiple threads concurrently. Regression test case for DERBY-3870.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  XMLConcurrencyTest.WorkerThread
      A thread class that does the actual work in the test.

    • Method Detail

      • suite

        public static junit.framework.Test suite()
        Create a suite of all test cases in this class.

      • testConcurrency

        public void testConcurrency()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Start four threads that execute queries that use all the XML operators. If each thread manages 100 iterations without failing, running concurrently with the other threads, the test case passes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createTestTable

        private static void createTestTable(java.sql.Statement s)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException

        Create a table with test data. The table contains three columns:

        1. An ID column used to identify the rows and to give a stable ordering.
        2. A VARCHAR column holding the string representation of an XML document.
        3. An XML column holding the XML representation of the document in the VARCHAR column.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • runXMLTest

        private static void runXMLTest(java.sql.Connection conn,
                               int iterations)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Do the work for one of the worker threads. Perform queries that use all the XML operators. Repeat the queries the specified number of times.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection on which to execute the queries
        iterations - the number of times each query should be executed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
